column4: Outlook *doesn't*, at least not anymore, unless you *pay* for it (explicitly)
I have it up and going under windows.  New version of outlook express.
Hmm, well, there's a few utilities that provide pop3 access to hotmail.
I am not saying windows is better, I am simply stating that I know that it does function with hotmail. ^^;;
You run it as a daemon, then use your email program of choice.
It isn't accessing it via pop3 right now.  :P IT is using the HTTP emial option. ^^;;
Think of it as a gateway.
At my uni, we have access via port 80 on proxy *ONLY*
Anyway, imagine  you have three computers.
One of them is hotmail (Actually, now that would be impressive)
You want your laptop to access hotmail via pop3
So you install something on your third computer that turns it into a pop3 server.
However, when you laptop accesses your pop3 server, that in turn accesses hotmail via http, that clear enough for you?
I get what you are saying. :)
